1.verse: Salutation - Paul, a prisoner [for the sake] of Christ Jesus (the Messiah, the Anointed), and our brother Timothy, To Philemon our dearly beloved friend and fellow worker,

2.verse: and to [your wife] Apphia our sister, and to Archippus our fellow soldier [in ministry], and to the church that meets in your house:

3.verse: Grace to you and peace [inner calm and spiritual well-being] from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

4.verse: Philemon’s Love and Faith - I thank my God always, making mention of you in my prayers,

5.verse: because I hear of your love and of your faith which you have toward the Lord Jesus and toward all the saints (God’s people).

6.verse: I pray that the sharing of your faith may become effective and powerful because of your accurate knowledge of every good thing which is ours in Christ.

7.verse: For I have had great joy and comfort and encouragement from your love, because the hearts of the saints (God’s people) have been refreshed through you, my brother.

8.verse: Therefore [on the basis of these facts], though I have enough confidence in Christ to order you to do what is appropriate,

9.verse: yet for love’s sake I prefer to appeal to you—since I am such a person as Paul, an old man, and now also a prisoner [for the sake] of Christ Jesus—

10.verse: A Plea for Onesimus to be Freed - I appeal to you for my [own spiritual] child Onesimus, whom I have fathered [in the faith] while a captive in these chains.

11.verse: Once he was useless to you, but now he is indeed useful to you as well as to me.

12.verse: I have sent him back to you in person, that is, like sending my very heart.

13.verse: I would have chosen to keep him with me, so that he might minister to me on your behalf during my imprisonment for the gospel;

14.verse: but I did not want to do anything without first getting your consent, so that your goodness would not be, in effect, by compulsion but of your own free will.

15.verse: Perhaps it was for this reason that he was separated from you for a while, so that you would have him back forever,

16.verse: no longer as a slave, but [as someone] more than a slave, as a brother [in Christ], especially dear to me, but how much more to you, both in the flesh [as a servant] and in the Lord [as a fellow believer].

17.verse: So if you consider me a partner, welcome and accept him as you would me.

18.verse: But if he has wronged you in any way or owes you anything, charge that to my account;

19.verse: I, Paul, write this with my own hand, I will repay it in full (not to mention to you that you owe to me even your own self as well).

20.verse: Yes, brother, let me have some benefit and joy from you in the Lord; refresh my heart in Christ.

21.verse: I write to you [perfectly] confident of your obedient compliance, since I know that you will do even more than I ask.

22.verse: At the same time also prepare a guest room for me [in expectation of a visit], for I hope that through your prayers I will be [granted the gracious privilege of] coming to you [at Colossae].

23.verse: Greetings to you from Epaphras, my fellow prisoner here in [the cause of] Christ Jesus,

24.verse: and from Mark, Aristarchus, Demas, and Luke, my fellow workers.

25.verse: The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit.
